replies.body:
Online relationships are interesting but do take a lot of dedication, as with physical relationships. You have to be devoted to the person, but online you just show devotion in some different ways. You absolutely have to know what the person looks like and talk to the person over voice to get a true feeling of who they are and how they feel. My advice is to be extremely careful and try to take logical judgements over pure emotions (as hard as that might be).

As for Avicus, you meet people in game and on out social platforms (slack, forums, teamspeak), and interact with them sometimes daily. It is natural to become attracted to a person and for people to become attracted to you. It is fine really as long as both parties agree on what not to share. You have to build up a lot of trust (more than IRL) in an online relationship. People have dated on this server, and many others, and just like any relationship, some have worked and some haven't. Just always use your best judgement.

Oh, and it always helps to meet the person IRL at some point soon in the future, that really shows devotion.

- ALM

As for Avicus, you meet people in game and on out social platforms (slack, forums, teamspeak), and interact with them sometimes daily. It is natural to become attracted to a person and for people to become attracted to you. It is fine really as long as both parties agree on what not to share. Just always use your best judgement.

Oh, and it always helps to meet the person IRL at some point soon in the future, that really shows devotion.

- ALM

You absolutely have to know what the person looks like and talk to the person over voice to get a true feeling of who they are and how they feel. My advice is to be extremely careful and try to take logical judgements over pure emotions (as hard as that might be).

As for Avicus, you meet people in game and on out social platforms (slack, forums, teamspeak), and interact with them sometimes daily. It is natural to become attracted to a person and for people to become attracted to you. It is fine really as long as both parties agree on what not to share. You have to build up a lot of trust (more than IRL) in an online relationship. People have dated on this server, and many others, and just like any relationship, some have worked and some haven't. Just always use your best judgement.

Oh, and it always helps to meet the person IRL at some point soon in the future, that really shows devotion.

- ALM

replies.body:
I don't think there's anything wrong with it. 
Dating online just works differently than IRL. But it still works. 

With the internet being used more and more in everyone's everyday lives, internet dating and other internet related concepts (shopping, streaming etc.) are becoming more and more normalised.

10 years ago the idea of internet dating was strange.
10 years ago the idea of internet shopping was strange.
10 years ago the idea of streaming your favourite to shows on demand was strange.

It's becoming the norm. 
The internet is just another tool people can use in any situation.
